title: T206 Griffith - Bowie Kuhn Collection - SOLD!
author: T206Collector

posts.post_title: T206 Griffith - Bowie Kuhn Collection - SOLD!
posts.post_content:
Would like to sell for what I won it for in this Hunt Auction a couple of years ago -- $488.75 ($425 + 15% BP) -- but at this point would consider any and all reasonable offers.
[URL="http://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/IPb8Kyc0JL_NgaCbzFAULA?feat=embedwebsite"][IMG]http://lh5.ggpht.com/_Ys7fw31kTDs/SEv3zRqgGiI/AAAAAAAAEEI/6uRdaNlskb4/s800/GriffithKuhnCollection.jpg[/IMG][/URL]
From [URL="http://picasaweb.google.com/pmifsud3d/SGCGradedCards?feat=embedwebsite"]SGC Graded Cards[/URL]
From the auction description: "Commissioner Bowie Kuhn's first baseball card. 1909-11 T-206 Clark Griffith tobacco card from the collection of Bowie Kuhn. Card grades SGC 20 FR with some creasing and has a Sweet Caporal back. The card was treasured by Commissioner Kuhn in part because of his first baseball experiences as a scoreboard attendant for Clark Griffith's Washington Senators. Graded by SGC with special designation as having originated from the Kuhn collection. Includes letter of provenance from the Kuhn family." [url]http://www.huntauctions.com/LIVE/imageviewer_online.cfm?auction_num=33&lot_num=623&lot_qual=[/url] I actually don't recall getting the "letter of provenance" from the Kuhn family, but I'll keep trying to track it down. The SGC slip may have to suffice.... Clean Sweet Cap 150 back. (SGC got it wrong on the factory - it is not a Sovereign back) If you're interested, please email me at [url]SignedT206@gmail.com[/url] Thanks!
That is really cool.  Nice card.

Bump -- now listening to all reasonable offers for this card.

Thanks
